hotciv.framework

Interface GameState

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Game, LoggingGame
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GameImpl, LoggingGameImpl

    public interface GameState

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void createCity(Position p)
      Creates a new city in the game at the specified location
      int getAge()
      return the age of the world.
      City getCityAt(Position p)
      return the city at position 'p' in the world.

      return the player that is 'in turn', that is, is able to move units and manage cities.

    • Method Detail

      • getTileAt

        Tile getTileAt(Position p)
        return a specific tile. Precondition: Position p is a valid position in the world.
        Parameters:
        p - the position in the world that must be returned.
        Returns:
        the tile at position p.

      • getUnitAt

        Unit getUnitAt(Position p)
        return the uppermost unit in the stack of units at position 'p' in the world. Precondition: Position p is a valid position in the world.
        Parameters:
        p - the position in the world.
        Returns:
        the unit that is at the top of the unit stack at position p, OR null if no unit is present at position p.

      • getCityAt

        City getCityAt(Position p)
        return the city at position 'p' in the world. Precondition: Position p is a valid position in the world.
        Parameters:
        p - the position in the world.
        Returns:
        the city at this position or null if no city here.

      • getPlayerInTurn

        Player getPlayerInTurn()
        return the player that is 'in turn', that is, is able to move units and manage cities.
        Returns:
        the player that is in turn

      • getWinner

        Player getWinner()
        return the player that has won the game.
        Returns:
        the player that has won. If the game is still not finished then return null.

      • getAge

        int getAge()
        return the age of the world. Negative numbers represent a world age BC (-4000 equals 4000 BC) while positive numbers are AD.
        Returns:
        world age.

      • getTilesWithCities

        java.util.List<Tile> getTilesWithCities()
        Getter for retrieving the tiles holding cities
        Returns:
        A list of the tiles currently holding a city

      • getTilesWithUnits

        java.util.List<Tile> getTilesWithUnits()
        Getter for retrieving the tiles holding units
        Returns:
        A list of the tiles currently holding units

      • createCity

        void createCity(Position p)
        Creates a new city in the game at the specified location
        Parameters:
        p - The position at which to create a new city

      • incrementPlayerWinCount

        void incrementPlayerWinCount(Player player)
        Increments the number of attacking wins a player has accumulated
        Parameters:
        player - the player for which to increase win count

      • getPlayerWinCount

        int getPlayerWinCount(Player player)
        Return the win count of the player.
        Parameters:
        player -
        Returns:
        the number of win count the player has
